result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvon D Ladd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alvon D Ladd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alvon D Ladd was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall complete the booking/fingerprinting process prior to release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  - Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
  - The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 1:00PM today.
  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
